item.description:
You are a deity; a god—one among many, perhaps—looking down upon the earth, upon this curious species called humans, and upon their still more curious behaviors. They’re very proud of themselves and their advancements, these humans, and they take themselves very seriously, what with their empire-building and their silly and relentless wars with one another. They have no clue how tiny they seem to you, like clever insects—how thousands of years of their civilization pass for you in a matter of minutes, and how completely subject they are to your whims. But, like them, you’re proud, too, ye god, and you do so very much delight when these humans notice you and praise you and create all these wonderful and diverse religions about you. And your very favorite thing of all is when they marshall their greatest talents, and the earth’s most precious resources, and they build monuments to you and all your glory. After all, where would they be at all if not for your influence and magnanimity?

The object of the game is to score as many points as possible, at the end of five progressive game ages (game phases) by influencing human activities (arranging card tableaus) and encouraging the construction of monuments (collecting suited sets).

The five nations of the game evolve through progressive game ages and through individual technology levels (tech levels). Different ages and tech levels dictate different circumstances and game rules. The five tech levels loosely correspond to the five game ages, but it is important to remember that the tech level of any individual nation might not be the same as the current game age (one or more nations can be “behind the times”).

Any time a nation’s individual tech level advances beyond the current game age, it will cause the game age to advance by one increment. Depending on other circumstances, other nations may or may not advance their own tech levels at the same time. When any nation advances beyond the steel age (V) and into the atomic age (the sixth, unmarked age card), the game ends, and you proceed to scoring.

—description from the publisher

Fours is a modern interpretation of the ancient Sumerian game The Royal Game of Ur. While inspired by that game, the rules have been simplified allowing for an easy-to-learn game that still has elements of chance with a need for strategy.

Like the original game, Fours is a race to move checkers through a course. Opponents can knock each other off the course, but there are 'safe' spaces. The 'fours' theme is evident throughout the game - dice yield a result of 1, 2, 3, or 4. Safe spaces occur every 4 spaces. Each player has four checkers to run through the course. A roll of 4 allows a player an extra roll.

One of the most unique design elements of the game is the portability. The game 'board' is actually a fabric game mat with a rubberized backing. This allows it to conveniently fold and pack into a small pouch easily carried in a purse, backpack, or briefcase. Unlike modern recreations of the game, a large, bulky wooden board is not required.

Dystopolis is a strategic board game taking place in a not-so-distant future where the free market has run amok and resulted in a decadent society. Each player represents a ruthless investor in the megacity Dystopolis. The aim is to outmanoeuvre the rivals through clever investments and by maximizing the profit from companies. Money can also be used to shamelessly bribe others into obedience. Action cards can be used to remove competing investments or to take over threatening companies - as long as the voting succeeds.

The game mechanics is a combination of area control, stock holding and economic negotiation through bribes and bidding. The strategy in Dystopolis is centered around the placement of company tiles and investment tokens. The players add company tiles to the modular game board during each round. To claim ownership the players then need to invest money in the companies. The companies establish connections to each other. More connections to other companies increases the revenue, but also makes the company more vulnerable to attacks. A player with limited influence in an area can compensate for this by saving pleny of money for bribes.

—description from the publisher

item.description:
This is a role playing board game focused at learning and discussing the theme of collaborative economy and its relation with open digital services. In particular focuses on platform coops as an alternative crowd-sourcing model with respect to privately owned network models. A main inspiring reference is Uberworked and Underpaid: How Workers Are Disrupting the Digital Economy by Trebor Scholz.

This is a board game that mixes role playing, card deck building, collaborative gameplay and transformative narrative aimed at exploring platform coops and their integration.

What is the object of the game? For the single Megacorp player, to acquire all the Platform Coops transforming them in its subsidiaries. For all other players, who play as Platform Coops, to earn 5 happiness points. Players can decide whether the game ends as soon as one Platform Coop reaches their goal, or all are required to reach the 5 happiness points.

How is it won or lost? Players win when they reach their goal.

What do players do in their turns? Each player picks a new card which goes in their hand, and also may play a card as a new service of the coop or Megacorp. Each player has then to pay taxes and compute earnings, which are determined by the cards that they have played. For coop players, the effects of the cards of their deck are integrated with those of the shared service which require all coops subscription to become effective.

The game is available as print and play, all materials available on Github with the rules. On Youtube there is a how-to-play video.

item.description:
Game Design is a tableau building game about designing a game. Players need to build their own game project of their best. Designing schedule, collecting ideas and demonstrating their games to the game enthusiasts.

This game consists of three rounds,and each round is with three turns. For the beginning of every round, players get four idea cards and do card drafting. In each turn, you and your opponents choose a flowchart tile and do the possible actions: (1) play a new idea card from your hand to expand your design, (2) collect resource from your design where your personal meeple is located, or (3)demonstrate part of your design(mechanic, theme or art) and get feedback, which mean your scores.
 
Every part of your game design shows the fame and the possibilities of your project. The game ends when all flowchart tiles are played. The winner belongs to who has the highest scores and will have the chance to publish the design.

—description from the designer

Choose your Champion, Enter the Contest! Inspired by the critically acclaimed mobile game, Contest of Champions: Battlerealm is a game of combat, strategy, and chance. Choose one of 13 fan-favorite Marvel champions, including Contest of Champions exclusives like Guillotine and Civil Warrior, roll the dice, and carefully allocate your ISO-8 to power up your champion and attack your opponents, travel to new locations, or activate powerful special abilities. Make every game unique in this fast-paced combat game as you battle your champions across 40 different locations!

item.description:
All six sectors of the province are under attack! Quick! Get those shields up now!

Raise the Shields is a print-and-play roll-and-write game of direct conflict. Seek to destroy your neighbor's cities while simultaneously working to erect shields in an effort to protect your own cities.

All players share two of the same dice while also rolling one personal dice. These three dice must be assigned to three different tasks:

 Work sector: Where will you work on connecting your shield generator to the power plant?
 Shape: What shape will you fill in order to connect the generator with the power?
 Attack: In what sector will you attack your neighbor?




Use these basic actions to erect shields, to destroy neighboring cities, and to open up new bonus abilities.

Be the first to raise all your shields or destroy an enemy city and you win the game!


 In the solo mode, instead of attacking other players, you will assign damage to yourself.


—description from the designer

item.description:
This board game is based on the anime series Yu-Gi-Oh! 5D's.

Players move around the board by rolling a die and attemp to collect Red Cards, collect Purple Cards, and win duels.

On a player's turn, they roll a die and move that many spaces. Each space on the board has an assigned action.
Red spaces: Draw a card from the Red Deck.
Purple spaces: Draw a card from the Purple Deck.
Spinner spaces: Spin the spinner and take the resulting action.
Cover spaces: Turn ends.
Move cover spaces: Move any cover, revealing an open Tunnel.
Tunnel spaces: Roll the die and move as many uncovered Tunnel spaces as the number shown on die.
Duel spaces: If a player's Red Card has a number greater than the Purple Card in the quadrant, then a duel occurs. Duels are resolved by rolling the duel dice.

The first player to accomplish the following four goals wins:

 Win 3 Duels
 Collect 4 Red Cards
 Collect 3 Purple Cards
 Competes in the final Turbo Duel and wins

Knight Court is a tiny chess-like abstract. Each side has a knight, bishop, and rook on a 3x3 board.

A captured bishop or rook is returned to its owner, who can re-introduce it onto any open space on a future turn. In contrast, a knight in jeopardy of capture is compelled to move, because checkmating an opponent's knight wins the game.

Overview:
Wardens is a 1 to 4 player post-apocalyptic adventure set in a lovecraftian steampunk universe, offering different types of scenarios such as 1vsAll, Solo and Co-op mode. 
One player will take the role of Cthulhu and his legion of Starspawns and spread madness over the humanity while the Wardens team co-operatively maneuver their steam-powered armies in the last battle for the survival of humankind. 
Join the fight in this immersive mythological strategy game.

Goal: 
As Cthulhu’s dreams are beyond humanity’s ability to defend against, only the Wardens â€‹â€‹are strong enough to travel the world in search of the powerful Artifacts that belonged to the Naacal. If found, the Artifacts can release the Elders who will fight one last time to return Cthluhu to his submerged stone-city where his nightmares can no longer harm humanity. 
To fight the Wardens’ armies and stop them from finding the Artifacts, Cthulhu and his powerful Starspawns will spread madness, turning the Wardens "Insane" and converting them to play against each-other.

Gameplay: 
One player will be taking the role of Cthluhu and control his Starspawns minions as they rise across the world and fight the Warden's armies. Cthulhu's Gameplay is focused in strategic movements and unit placement. The Great Old One travels through various portals across the map and spreading madness, he corrupts the Wardens at his will, forcing the insane player to fight against his allies. 
Every time The Wardens perish in battle, Cthulhu grows stronger and uses the defeated army’s power to raise his legion with his mutation tree.

1-3 players are the Wardens, each controlling their own steam-powered army over land, water and sky. The vehicles can be upgraded with hidden Blueprints in order to take control of territories, fight Starspawns, call for reinforcement and go on Expedition, in search for Artifacts.

Each Warden has their own characteristics, abilities and strategies, each presenting a unique gameplay experience and adding a lot of replay-value to the game. Since their actions are so different, they must absolutely work in coalition if they want to survive. 
They must use their special abilities, spend distinct free actions, unique masteries and designated pet companion skills to fight the enemy's legion.

Battles in Wardens are diceless. Instead, opponents will engage in a strategic mini-game to read each other's mind by tossing Strategy Battle Coins using a battle pyramid mechanic deciding your fate.

Wardens also includes different mechanics such as Prophecy and Ability cards which add yet another dynamic to gameplay.

During the Co-op and Solo Scenarios, the Wardens will fight against the Game as Cthulhu's actions will be automated.

Will the Wardens prove strong enough to prevail against Cthulhu, or will humanity be lost to madness?

History:
The annals of prehistory describe a time of peace and unprecedented enlightenment and creativity lead by a mysterious earthly race called, the Naacal. 
A hostile and cosmic family of entities lead by Cthulhu invaded the world seeking to usurp the Naacal’s power and send humanity into madness. 
The Naacal Elders, with the aid of powerful Artifacts contained Cthulhu and his Starspawn, entombing him in a Stone-city where he sleeps to this day at the bottom of the ocean, forgotten in history.
The Elders retreat, allowing the world to set its own future but not before establishing a Naacalean bloodline of guardians to watch and defend, known as The Brotherhood. The most powerful and trained of these guardians were known as Wardens, sworn to keep vigil over the cosmic threat that slumbers beneath the world through their superhuman ability and with the power of the Artifacts.
Thousands of years later an unearthed scroll warns of Cthulhu’s return to seek vengeance on the Naacal and humanity itself – that warning comes to pass as an awakening Cthulhu spreads his tentacles across the world, this time imprisoning the Naacal Elders. The Brotherhood is left in ruins as the world falls to madness and burns.
Time is running out for humanity’s remnant and only our three remaining Wardens stand between Cthulhu freely roaming the world and humanity becoming enslaved to his madness.

item.description:
Tournament Fishing is a card game that involves memory, luck, and strategy. Each participating Angler will compete on a common Lake, attempting to catch the biggest and best fish before the Tournament ends.

Since the Fish are hidden in the Lake, Anglers will need to locate and recall their positions from turn to turn in order to have the best chance to catch them, although they might get lucky and attract them unaware as well!

Face off against fellow friends and family in a 2-4 Angler game, or have a go at it alone (or in a 2-Angler Co-op!) against the challenging Angler AI. Never before has it been so fun to go fishing from the comfort of your own home!

item.description:
The year is 2123 and the planet earth is becoming uninhabitable. New powers of interstellar travel make it possible for earthlings to find a new home. Competing teams of human explorers use space stations spread throughout the universe as bases for discovering new worlds and befriending aliens to help them in their quest. Explorer teams are not only racing each other, but an alien race also hoping to discover the planets. Will your team be able to reach a planets before the others to establish colonies?

Cosmic Run: Regeneration is a revised version of Cosmic Run. Like the original, Cosmic Run: Regeneration is a quick, push-your-luck, space race for 1-4 players. On a turn, a player rolls dice and must commit at least 1 of them to one of the various exploration tracks or to an alien card. Some of the tracks require multiple identical dice, with the most valuable tracks costing many identical dice. However, once a player commits a die, it cannot be moved. So players have to decide between a conservative approach (making sure and steady progress along less valuable tracks) or an aggressive approach (pushing one's luck to try to move up the highly valued tracks).

Players may opt to use their dice to befriend aliens, rather than explore, because the aliens provide special powers that can eventually help them move along their exploration tracks even faster. The game may be played competitively or cooperatively.

Cosmic Run: Regeneration is different from the original Cosmic Run in many ways. Regarding the rules, these are the main changes:
- A 6th planet track with its own rules for placement
- A 6th type of alien card
- The mechanism for the alien race landing on planets (which used to be meteors hitting planets) is now card-based, rather than dice
- Alien cards must be turned in during the game to score points
- Alien cards are one use and easier to acquire

The game's components are also different, insofar as this game has a full board and some updated graphic design.

item.description:
CIV: Carta Impera Victoria is a game of CIVilization and diplomacy in which you develop your own civilization. Be the first to reach supremacy in one field to make history, but keep an eye on how your opponents are advancing. Forming a temporary alliance might be the best way to keep a player from triumphing…and remember that offense is sometimes the best defense!

In more detail, a player wins when they reach supremacy in a field; if this doesn't happen, when no more cards can be drawn, the game ends and players go through a majority scoring to determine the winner.

CIV includes six fields of competition: Army, Religion, Economics, Science, Culture, and Utopia. The 104 cards in the game are split in three ages, which represent the natural evolution of global civilization through the timeline, but the cards of each field aren't split equally. Once the second age has finished, for example, if you haven't yet reached supremacy of Religion, it's time to think about another strategy.

Each field gives powers to the player who succeeds in reaching the limit of cards in their play area (depending on the number of players). There are different kinds of powers, two levels of permanent effects, and one sacrifice effect for each field. Using these powers in combination will be necessary to be the first to reach supremacy — but using these powers is also a way to keep competitors from reaching victory.

You will need all your diplomacy skills to get help from others and prevent the leading player from winning, yet today's friend could be tomorrow's enemy, so pay attention to all and think about which combination of powers might lead to a surprise victory! Be the first to use it!

The game includes rules for 1v1 play, 2v2 team play, and 3-4 player games.

item.description:
Words Race! is a fun party/family board game that will bring you and your friends hours of entertainment!.
How many specific words can you say in less than a minute? Is not that easy!. Players must say out loud, the most quantity of words according to their respective letter and word category, this way, players go forward the gameboard. But be fast! Time may run out, action cards may engage you help other players! Or you may find yourself going backwards through the board!
Also, there are many action cards, challenge cards and wildcards that will help you in your journey towards the end of the board.
There are many Word Category Cards and Action Cards, players must follow the exact instructions on the cards. The game is for up to 6 single players or up to 6 teams of 2 players each, so we have a total of 12 players!
Note: This game is produced by the author at his home. The first print run is 30 copies, then it will be produced on-demand.

—description from the designer

Español:

Carrera de Palabras! es un divertidísimo juego para jugar con amigos, en una fiesta o reunión, y con la familia.
¿Cuántas palabras podés decir en 1 minuto? No es tan fácil!
Cada jugador en su turno debe decir la mayor cantidad de palabras posibles de su correspondiente categoría y letra, de esta manera van avanzando en el tablero. Pero se debe jugar rápido!, el tiempo puede acabarse o las Tarjetas de Acción pueden obligarte a ayudar a otros jugadores! Cuidado! también podés encontrarte yendo hacia atrás por el tablero!, pero por suerte hay muchas tarjetas de Comodines, Acciones y Desafíos,que te ayudarán en tu camino a la victoria.
Con las Tarjetas de Categoría y de Acción, los jugadores deben seguir las instrucciones de las mismas. Juegan de 2 a 6 jugadores independientes o se pueden armar de 2 a 6 parejas, lo que hace un total de 12 jugadores!
Nota: Este juego lo produce el mismo autor en su casa. La primera tirada es de 30 copias, luego se producirá a pedido.

—descripción provista por el diseñador

item.description: "The Kaladesh Inventors' Fair, a celebration of innovation and ingenuity, was a ruse. A revolt takes place on Kaladesh. The renegades have seized control of large portions of Ghirapur. Led by Pia Nalaar and aligned with aether-pirates, essence-drainers and weaponsmiths, they seek to overthrow the authority of the Consulate. The Consulate responds with increased security and surveillance, the seizure of unregistered inventions, the monitoring of aether distribution, and the enforcement of a city-wide curfew. The Gatewatch and Ajani Goldmane support the renegades, while searching for the nefarious planeswalker Tezzeret." Look for all new mechanics in Aether Revolt like 'Improvise' that enables you to pay a generic mana cost with the help of your artifacts, also look for new cycles and themes to continue exploring the world of Kaladesh. Aether Revolt products are available in the following configurations, make sure to check the Title and Description of each listing to determine which item or items are included in the listing.

Kooky Carnival is an educational roll and move game for 2-4 players age 6 and up and published by Lakeshore Games. The following is excerpted from the Lakeshore website: 
"Who can be the first to collect 6 carnival tickets? Students read fun passages, then use context clues to answer questions about them in this fast-paced reading game. Each correct answer earns the player a ticket—the first one to get 6 tickets wins! Includes game board, 50 question cards, 28 carnival tickets, decoder, 4 pawns and a die. For 2-4 players."

name.value: Rick and Morty: Tráfico de Megasemillas

item.description:
Morty has smashed the portal gun while he and Rick collected megaseeds.
Now there is no other way to go through the interdimensional customs and, for this, you have to get the mega-seeds well deeeeeeep in the ass.
This is not tasteful dish for anyone, so you have to try to avoid it in any way. How to get it?

—description from the publisher (translated)

El inútil de Morty ha destrozado la pistola de portales mientras 
él y Rick recolectaban megasemillas.
Ahora no queda otra que pasar por la aduana interdimensional y, para ello, hay que meterse las mega-semillas bien hooooondo por el culo.
Esto no es plato de buen gusto para nadie, por lo que hay que intentar evitarlo de cualquier manera. ¿Cómo conseguirlo?
—description from the publisher (Spanish)

item.description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Quiz of the year 2017'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about quiz of the year 2017. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

Microbrew is a medium-weight worker placement / puzzle game hybrid for two players: The Tiny Tin Brewery have challenged YOU - leaders of their two most skilled brewing teams to a brew off! Who will create the tastiest beers and win the most loyal customers? Only one way to find out - Ready! Set! Brew!

In Microbrew, players will take turns sending brewers to work stations to mash, brew, bottle and serve their own beer recipes to a stream of thirsty customers. Work stations aren't locked out like most other worker placement games - if you really want to push someone out - you can, but their worker goes back to be reused this turn! This means rounds are very dynamic and require careful thought to not just optimise your little team but also to predict where your opponent wants to be so you can ride their wave!

Brewing isn't just worker placement though - each player has their own "Copper" brewing kettle where their brewer's actions can let them play a simple but fiendish puzzle game to reorganise their kettle and complete a perfect recipe. Or not! Will you try to make each customer's perfect beer and win their loyalty, or will you flood the market with average brews and let the marketing money do its thing?

Set in the early 20th century of entrepreneurs and chocolatiers experimenting with new ways to create and market chocolates, YOU are assigned the task of chief chocolate maker! Chocolate factory, a euro game of literal factory building and moving (using a pushable conveyer belt component) chocolates you must complete the most amount of chocolates required by retailers for the best value. The game also features wooden chocolate pieces and a movable conveyer belt making the physicality blended with euro mechanics a unique experience.

Gameplay overview:
Players are each given a starting player board which will have two Factory parts which apply to a physical conveyer belt. The conveyer belt part of the player board contains long slot with an empty region in which to push square tiles along. The tiles will house the chocolate pieces players will manipulate throughout the game.

During the game players will initially draft new factory parts (to add to their player board) and specialists (one time use cards with special powers).

Then each player will “push” three times cocoa into their machines. During each “push” players will be able to use fuel and their factory parts to manipulate their Chocolate pieces. Careful consideration will be required for the spatial element of the game as Chocolate pieces can only be manipulated during a push by the Factory part that is adjacent to their tile.

Players score points by creating chocolates for public and personal objectives. The player with the most points at the end wins.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Thinking'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about figuring out if certain sentences are right or wrong. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

STARS & CROSSES: Wargame rules for company-level battles on the Western Front in World War 2 in 6mm scale. Incredibly simple and flexible rule system.

Easy to learn, with modular expert rules you can use to customize your game play. Includes a PDF with printable counters and terrain hexes. Can be played as a hybrid board/miniatures game, thanks to unit bases that double as board game counters, with essential combat stats printed right on the unit base! Each player takes the role of a US Army or Wehrmacht platoon or company leader, with one or more platoons at his disposal, plus additional units purchased with a point-buy system.

Features include:

Hex-based movement (no rulers needed!)
 Intuitive range and sighting rules
 Command and initiative
 Custom-equip your rifle squads with snipers, bazookas, panzerfausts, and more
 Infantry close assault and armor overrun rules
 Ground attacks by air units
 Called artillery fire
 Wounded, medics, and aid stations
 Specialized ammo like white phosphorus, smoke, and proximity shells
 Stats for dozens of infantry and vehicle units

In "Hegemony, Shadows of Power”, powerful leaders struggle to make their Cause prevail in a re-emerging fantasy world. Manage your power, negotiate, form alliances and bluff to make your way to supremacy.

Players begin the game with different initial powers. In each turn, a Challenge is revealed, and Leaders choose to take part in it or not. Players who dispute the Challenge try to negotiate and convince others to join their alliance. Alliances dispute the prize by betting face-down Power cards and reinforcements; and leaders may bluff with their bets. Once the bets are revealed, the Alliance with the most power is declared the winner and obtains the Challenge's reward (Cause points). Gather 10 or more Cause points to win the match.

(publisher info)

StoryWorld is a card game whose main objective is to tell a story among all the players using their imagination and creativity. It's a game without language dependence for all ages that guarantees really fun moments. Ideal for children, fun for adults.

It's not a competitive game, rather it is a collaborative game that seeks to strengthen teamwork and moments of coexistence.

The game is composed of cards, which only contain drawings that must be interpreted by the players when telling their part of the story. Each player decides what to say during his turn following the course of the story.

—description from the designer

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: ブレンドコーヒーラボ (Blend Coffee Lab.)

item.description:
Blend Coffee Lab is a trick-taking card game about pairing roasted coffee beans to make delicious coffee blends. Each player is a worker in the coffee lab, tirelessly working day and night to research coffee blending; pursue a unique, harmonious flavor, while keeping current trends in mind; and create a new, harmonious flavor that could never be made from a single origin source.

In game terms, players each have a hand of cards. The leader of the trick plays a card, and each other player in turn must lay down a card of a color not yet played, if possible. Players are trying to collect cards in order to complete cups of coffee. Cards come in three roasts — light, medium, and dark — and four colors. To create a cup, you need cards in all four colors in a single roast. When you do this, you score points equal to the sum of the card values that compose that cup. If you match the round's roast, you score 10 bonus points.

You track your scores over three rounds, and at the end of three rounds, you keep only your highest score in each roast across the three rounds, then sum those values to determine the final winner.

Publisher's summary
ãƒ–ãƒ¬ãƒ³ãƒ‰ã‚³ãƒ¼ãƒ’ãƒ¼ãƒ©ãƒœ (BLEND COFFEE Lab.) is a trick-taking card game about pairing roasted coffee beans to make delicious coffee blends. Players are workers in a coffee lab researching blending. 
Making a great blend requires carefully balancing the 4 aspects of a bean's flavor: "Acidity", "Aroma", "Body", and "Sweetness". Pursue a unique, harmonious flavor, keeping current trends in mind.

In The Ancient Evil up to 4 players will take on the role of investigators trying to thwart the plans of the evil cults, 
controlled by a fifth. This fifth evil player or 'Games Master' will be in charge of driving the scenario, creating an atmosphere of mystery and suspense for investigators. The 'Games Master' will find everything they need to keep the investigators on edge; summoning cultists and monsters, as well as introducing plot twists, special events, and more. And the closer the investigators get the more powerful he will become.

During each scenario the investigators are free to proceed as they wish but every action they take in their attempts to solve the mystery generates 'menace' which in turn fuels the powers of the 'Game Master'.

Both investigators and enemies use a points system to perform different actions. Some actions, such as moving and attacking are limited in how many times they can be performed on a turn.
Actions are resolved using a D10 dice, rolled against the relevant skill, to determine success ranging from critical failure to a critical success. Critical results will be unique to the item or action being used/taken. Some enemies can even take and use items and equipment against the investigators.

Facing off against the Ancient Evil the investigators are in constant danger of falling to insanity. Exposure to otherworldly creatures, eldritch magic and unnatural events all threaten to drain their precious sanity. Such mental trauma can result in 
episodes of temporary insanity or phobias which impact on an investigators ability to perform actions. Investigators pushed to the brink may even become completely insane. But this does not eliminate the investigator who, after flipping their character sheets to reveal an insane version, will continue to play.

The game comes with a scenario book containing numerous missions that can be played alone or linked as a campaign. But it doesn't end there. With the many tiles, enemies and other components you will have the tools to create your own scenarios. We are also committed to supporting the game and keeping to alive by, amongst other things, providing even more scenarios via our website which will be free to download.

—description from the designers

In Semifinal Fantasy you are a villager, hanging out in your local tavern, betting on which band of merry adventurers will survive each path of a dungeoncrawl. You will pick your adventurers, spend your coins to boost their stats, and then sit back and watch as the dice determine their fate in the old Bracket Dungeon. You'll also place bets on your favorite groups, trying to gain complete sets of Red, Green and Purple coins. In the end, all of your adventurers may be dead and gone, but you can still be the king of Semifinal Fantasy!

—description from the publisher

DICEYMON is a strategic chess type board game. Players command either side of the faction, roll the special designed dice to summon his monsters army and take down the opponent’s base. Each monster has its unique ability, you should use them well, play the best move in order to snow ball the advantage.

Element of DICEYMON:


 Technique oriented game, player win by his strategy and luck.
 Simple rule and easy to learn how to play, no such restriction on all the possible action.
 Different from of field building, where most of board game are either square or hexagon.
 Every game will be unique game, not possible to repeat a same match.
 Dice Pool building, more character will join the game upon development.
 High quality of game tool is a must:
 Top quality of miniatures ( Japanese figure quality with full color)
 Special designed game dice, we think it is close to perfect
 Crystal like plastic game token
 Game board with magnetic connection
 


—description from the publisher

World War 1 Australian war game for 2 players from the National Game Company. The object of the game is for each player to strategically place 9 howitzers playing pieces in a position along a World war 1 trench line to capture their opponents howitzers.

When 3 howitzers are in aligned along the trench line the player calls out "Trio" and may remove any opponents howitzers. Failure to make this call forfeits the opportunity of a capture.

Players take turns in moving howitzers around the trenches to align their howitzer guns. If a player places a howitzer in a position where trenches meet thus completing a trio in two directions he may call "Terror" and either captures an opponents piece or replace a gun previously lost.

The game is over when a player does not have enough howitzers to form a trio and he has lost the battle.

Boy Scouts is an Australian patriotic game first registered in 1911 by the National Game Company. Subsequent later versions appeared until around the 1930s.

The game is a simple roll and move mechnism along a path starting at the Australian red ensign flag and progressing to a final camp destination 90 moves away. The later version has the flag at the end.

Along the journey players can benefit or be penalized by landing on certain numbers, such as miss a turn, extra throw, advance or be sent back.

The player to reach camp first is declared the winner.

—user summary

One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme '3 in Time'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here you get 3 simple questions that you have to answer quickly. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.
